pr_title: [RW-5404][risk=low] GetRuntime: support user override runtime semantics

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this check be after the stream/filter?
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: I put it here since I'm not filtering anything but I suppose I can just check for the mostRecentRuntime optional and that should work.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: I would clarify that this includes deleted runtimes, e.g. listRuntimesByProjectWithDeleted(); or else plumb the boolean through. Distinction is otherwise unclear between these two methods
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: I don't know if there's an elegant way of doing this, but if we encounter an old and invalid runtime, it would be nice to bail here and just return a 404. I'm not sure if we can expect that manifest as an NPE out of the mapper, or perhaps as a malformed runtime.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
I can just catch RuntimeExceptions for now? it will cover some cases like invalid configuration types. It should also continue to work as we add more validation checks.
I'm not too worried about catching exceptions over eagerly either. I think anything that throws here is fine to 404.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: opt_nit: should there just be mapper methods between the enum and storage string ? Feels like this could provide better isolation
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: hmm, the main reason I didn't do a mapper method is b/c Mapstruct wouldn't be able to pick it up anyways. I think the way it is now is fine but we can refactor later if we need the isolation.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: It's possible there are some degenerate entries missing this  - I would make this sort method immune to null auditInfo and createdDate (treat these as older)
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: What's the status on this? Is it intentionally omitted by Leo?
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: I verified that it is not actually sent through in the JSON response. Just shot off a message to the Leo team about it.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.message: address code review; handle null cases in ListRuntimes response; throw 404s on error

timeline.bodyText: This should at least be logged
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: I would scope this as tightly as possible, i.e. directly around the mapper call - RuntimeException catch-alls are problematic in that they may mask programming errors.
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: opt_nit: I would just exercise the LeonardoMapper here. If you're also trying to cover conversion testing here, probably I'd split that out into a LeonardoMapperTest
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: wasn't sure if this is what you had in mind but I could only use LeonardoMapper to map dataprocConfigObj to dataprocConfig. Not as ideal as going the other direction but I also don't have that code implemented right now since we're not doing Runtime -> Leonardo mapping atm.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment here. I believe this logic exists because older runtimes without the label can only be default dataproc configs.
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: nit: generally java local vars should not have underscores in them
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: Wait - these are strings? If so, I don't think the comparison below is going to work as expected. Probably need a date / instant parsing step in here.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText:
I think it works as long as we receive the timestamps in a consistent timezone.
"easily comparable and sortable with a trivial string comparison"
https://fits.gsfc.nasa.gov/iso-time.html
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: going to merge since I have approval and tests are passing but I can add something later if this is still a concern
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Oh wow, wasn't aware of that property. That's quite useful, thanks.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.message: code review - tightening try/catch scope, some test modifications
